qas.question: When did the FBI first appear in popular media?
What notable TV show was concerned with FBI investigations of the paranormal?
What is the TV drama 24 designed on?
Who is the movie Point Break Based on?
Who is the movie Donnie Brasco based on?
What was frequently depicted in popular media before the 1930s?
What is not a notable portrayal of the FBI on television?
What has the FBI never done with popular media?
What is patterned after the Counter Terrorist Unit?
What 1991 movie is not based on a true story?

context: The <b5_0>FBI<b5_0/> has been frequently depicted in popular media since the <a0_0>1930s<a0_0/>. The bureau has participated to varying degrees, which has ranged from direct involvement in the creative process of film or TV series development, to <b7_0>providing consultation on operations<b7_0/> and closed cases. A few of the notable portrayals of the FBI on television are the 1993-2002 series <b6_0>The <a1_0>X-Files<b6_0/><a1_0/>, which concerned investigations into paranormal phenomena by five fictional Special Agents and the fictional Counter Terrorist Unit (CTU) agency in the TV drama 24, which is patterned after the <a2_0><b8_0>FBI Counterterrorism Division<b8_0/><a2_0/>. The 1991 movie <b9_0>Point Break<b9_0/> is based on the true story of an <a3_0>undercover FBI agent<a3_0/> who infiltrated a gang of bank robbers. The 1997 movie Donnie Brasco is based on the true story of undercover FBI agent <a4_0>Joseph D. Pistone<a4_0/> infiltrating the Mafia.
